snippet: CGI Federal had come under fire from the Obama administration for the glitches that plagued the rollout of the HealthCare.gov website.
abstract: CGI Federal, contractor hired to build the computer enrollment system for the health care reform law, says it will stop working on the troubled insurance exchange when its contract expires in February 2014; CGI, which was blamed by many in the Obama administration for rollout's computer glitches, insists it was not fired.
lead_paragraph: CGI Federal had come under fire from the Obama administration for the glitches that plagued the rollout of the HealthCare.gov website.

headline.main: Contractor for Health Portal Replaced, but Says ‘We Were Not Fired’
headline.print_headline: Contractor for Health Portal Replaced, but Says ‘We Were Not Fired’
